content.description:
A truly enjoyable boulder that is blessed by natural air conditioning and cursed by moisture. Apparently the boulder often seeps, so if it even remotely dry - get on it. 

 Sit start on two sloping holds in the left seam (red circle in the picture) with a choice of footwork depending on style/size. Work your way up and right to a positive side pull crug (crimp jug) using one of many possible sequences while being careful to avoid wet foot crystals. From here, another few moves, again with a variety of tricks, gets you to the lip of the boulder and a relatively chill top out.
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter. Relatively flat landing.
content.location: Even Lovely is located off of carriage road just past the main Sleepy Hollow section containing The Art of Nothing. Alternatively, if looking at The Art of Nothing, Even Lovely is just downhill to the right of the main boulder (you can follow a small trail with steps down).

content.description: Start all the way down in the cave on the left side of the sleepy hollow boulder. Your left hand starts on the corner and your right on the cornery hold. Climb right to the arete, and then compress through the overhanging face.
content.protection: Lots of pads. Landing is suboptimal. A slider would also be a good idea.
content.location: Cave on the left side of the sleepy hollow boulder

content.description: Start low with your left hand on the arete and your right hand on the slopey rail. Climb up the face just to the right of spring training. Top out on blocky holds.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. Landing is rough.

content.description: Start matched on crimp feature out right. Move left for a couple moves, then up to jugs. Top out slightly right.
content.location: Just to the right of Even Lovely if you're looking straight at that problem; around the corner, same boulder. Starts low in the cave.

content.description: Start sitting with both hands on big left flake. Climb up great holds to the obvious break and then jump down.
content.protection: Pads. Spotter not necessary but definitely couldn't hurt.
content.location: Far right of the Sleepy Hollow boulder.

content.description: Originally rated V9, this classic crimp problem is a must-try for the area and the Gunks as a whole. Starting on an obvious jug flake, make a big move to a finger slot, and then shoot for a two handed edge. Fire to edge and then traverse to get down.
content.protection: At least two pads and a spotter. Landing is bumpy.

content.description: Start sitting with left hand on the India-shaped feature (it actually looks like India, trust me). Right hand on a sidepull. Slap up the sidepulls on India and finish on the obvious break. Hang and drop to the ground for a 10/10 landing.
content.location: Right of The Art of Nothing. Look for the India shape.

content.description: This is the page for the boulder problems at Sleepy Hollow. There are a few great problems in this area.
